com.alex323glo.spacex.controller

Interface UserController


  • public interface UserController
    Business logic of User actor.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    alex323glo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addPersonalInfo(java.lang.String email, UserInfo userInfo)
      Updates personal info container of registered user.
      java.lang.String logIn(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Gives access to client as registered user.
      java.lang.String logOut(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String accessToken)
      Loges user out.
      java.lang.String signIn(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)

    • Method Detail

      • signIn

        java.lang.String signIn(java.lang.String email,
                        java.lang.String password)
                 throws EmailDuplicationException,
                        ArgumentValidationException
        Registers (signs in) new user in the system.
        Parameters:
        email - user's email, which must be unique.
        password - user's password.
        Returns:
        accessToken, generated after client's successful registration.
        Throws:
        EmailDuplicationException - if entered email is not unique - system's DB contains registered user with equal email.
        ArgumentValidationException - when any argument doesn't pass validation.
        See Also:
        *

      • logIn

        java.lang.String logIn(java.lang.String email,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws AccessRestrictionException,
                       ArgumentValidationException
        Gives access to client as registered user.
        Parameters:
        email - user's email, equal to target registered user.
        password - user's password, equal to target registered user.
        Returns:
        accessToken, generated after client's successful log in.
        Throws:
        AccessRestrictionException - if entered email and/or password are not valid or didn't pass verification.
        ArgumentValidationException - when any argument doesn't pass validation.
        See Also:
        AccessRestrictionException, ArgumentValidationException

      • addPersonalInfo

        java.lang.String addPersonalInfo(java.lang.String email,
                                 UserInfo userInfo)
                          throws EmailNotExistsException,
                                 ArgumentValidationException
        Updates personal info container of registered user.
        Parameters:
        email - unique email of User in system's DB, whose info we want to update.
        userInfo - part of user info, which will be updated in system's DB.
        Returns:
        token, which informs client about successful update.
        Throws:
        EmailNotExistsException - when system's DB doesn't contain registered user with email equal to entered one.
        ArgumentValidationException - when any argument doesn't pass validation.
        See Also:
        UserInfo, EmailNotExistsException, ArgumentValidationException

      • logOut

        java.lang.String logOut(java.lang.String email,
                        java.lang.String accessToken)
                 throws EmailNotExistsException,
                        TokenNotExistsException,
                        ArgumentValidationException
        Loges user out. Destroys access token, when client, who used it before to access service as registered user, loges out from system.
        Parameters:
        email - email of user in system's DB, which client used to access services.
        accessToken - token which will be marked as not valid - will be removed from list of accessTokens in system's DB.
        Returns:
        token, which informs client about successful log out.
        Throws:
        EmailNotExistsException - when system's DB doesn't contain registered user with email equal to entered one.
        TokenNotExistsException - when system's DB doesn't contain such accessToken.
        ArgumentValidationException - when any argument doesn't pass validation.
        See Also:
        EmailNotExistsException, TokenNotExistsException, ArgumentValidationException
